examples.sentence: お腹が空いた。(Onaka ga suita.)
お腹がいっぱい。(Onaka ga ippai.)

collocations: お腹が空く (onaka ga suku) - to become hungry
お腹いっぱい (onaka ippai) - full stomach
お腹を壊す (onaka wo kowasu) - to have an upset stomach

etymology.value: Japanese word for stomach or belly.

inflection.notes: No inflection as it is a noun.

usage_notes.explanation: 'Onaka' is a polite and common way to refer to the stomach or belly in Japanese. It's used in everyday conversation.

example_sentences.sentence: 赤ちゃんのお腹は柔らかい。(Akachan no onaka wa yawarakai.)
食べ過ぎてお腹が苦しい。(Tabesugite onaka ga kurushii.)
example_sentences.translation: I ate too much and my stomach feels uncomfortable.
